snippet: Amazon.com inspires anxiety just about everywhere, but its publishing arm is getting pushback from all sorts of booksellers, David Streitfeld reports in Monday's New York Times. They are scorning the imprint's most prominent title, Timothy Ferriss's...
abstract: Amazon.com inspires anxiety just about everywhere, but its publishing arm is getting pushback from all sorts of booksellers, David Streitfeld reports in Monday's New York Times. They are scorning the imprint's most prominent title, Timothy Ferriss's "The 4-Hour Chef." That book is coming out just before Thanksgiving into a fragmented book-selling landscape.

headline.main: Daily Report: A Cold Shoulder for Amazon as Publisher
